DataElement.preferredName: Person Prior Chemotherapy Exclusion Criteria Ind-3b
DataElement.preferredDefinition: a response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or not applicable related to prior chemotherapy as exclusion criteria that restricts entrance or bars participation in a clinical trial.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to prior chemotherapy as exclusion criteria that restricts entrance or bars participation in a clinical trial.

Property.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order.:The use of synthetic or naturally-occurring chemicals for the treatment of diseases.  Although this term may be used to describe any therapy involving the use of chemical-based agents, it is most commonly used to refer to the variety of chemical-based agents employed to treat cancer.  Cancer chemotherapy works by arresting or killing the growth and spread of cancer cells.  Because cancer cells usually divide much faster than normal cells, they are often very sensitive to the inhibitory actions of chemotherapeutic agents.  Chemotherapy may also include agents that enhance immune function or alter hormonal activity. (NCI04):Exclusion; the act of restricting entrance or barring from participation.

Concepts.definition: The use of synthetic or naturally-occurring chemicals for the treatment of diseases.
Medical and/or social characteristics that prevent a subject from being allowed to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ReferenceDocuments.description: Chemotherapy <=3 weeks prior to study entry

ReferenceDocuments.description: Systemic chemotherapy for the study cancer < 2 weeks prior to study entry?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient received prior chemotherapy for treatment of endometrial cancer?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text_1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Were other therapies directed at treating the cancer including chemotherapy, biologic/targeted agents, and immunologic agents discontinued at least 28 days prior to enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did the patient have chemotherapy, investigational drugs or radiotherapy within 3 weeks prior to study registration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received myelosuppressive chemotherapy within 21 days of entry onto this study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received myelosuppressive chemotherapy within 28 days of entry onto this study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF_Text_3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient received chemotherapy and all toxicities related to prior treatment recovered to <= Grade 1 prior to registration?

ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient received chemotherapy within 28 days prior to registration?
